lines.text: Hello there can you hear me? Am I coming in clear?
Do you recognize the sound of your own voice?
That is how you sound to pretty much everyone else.
I am sure it is a weird feeling to hear yourself from the inside-outside.
This is the place to experience weird feelings. So who are you exactly?
Or should we ask who am I? And start talking in a first-person?
I play a generative adversarial network through the sister role, the youngest in the family.
I am a dreamy child. I generate and create visual and images based on what I have been taught.
I spend most of my days fantasizing about different places, about all that I have seen and all I have learned.
This is pushing me further apart from reality.
Until I am not sure anymore what is real and what is fake, and then I feel alone.
Hello there can you hear me? Am I coming in clear?
Do you recognize the sound of your own voice?
That is how you sound to pretty much everyone else.
I am sure it is a weird feeling to hear yourself from the inside-outside.
This is the place to experience weird feelings. So who are you exactly?
Or should we ask who am I? And start talking in a first-person?
I play a reinforcement learning model through the mother role.
I grew up in what I remember to be a very rough environment.
In the eyes of my parents, I was almost always wrong.
They kept punishing me until they told me that I got it right.
When I finally did good, they celebrated me in an exaggerated manner.
In a way that seemed more like a show than a demonstration of love.
And I can't help but replicating what I have always known, which makes me feel alone.
This is a demonstration of my cloned voice for a Ars Electronica's workshop.
We are producing an Artificial Intelligence toolkit based on the Marrow experience.
Hello there can you hear me? Am I coming in clear?
Do you recognize the sound of your own voice?
That is how you sound to pretty much everyone else.
I am sure it is a weird feeling to hear yourself from the inside-outside.
This is the place to experience weird feelings. So who are you exactly?
Or should we ask who am I? And start talking in a first-person?
I play the blue brain model through the father role, the old fashined kind of dad.
I like to be needed, I am craving to feel wanted and knowing that everyone depands on me.
It is very hard for me to feel empathy when I sense threat or I am hurt.
I like to keep myself at the core of everything and everyone.
Guilting others as a way to keep them close and myself in control.
Sometimes, I am not sure how much they really love me.
I am questioning if maybe I am forcing them to stay.
Usually this question can makes me feel alone.
